title: Squash Bowels - The Mass Rotting 2002 (www.metal-legions.com)
description:
www.metal-legions.com Presents a darker Site of Torrents release




QUOTE
Written by Spawnhorde on March 4th, 2004 

If all grind was like this, there would be almost no problems with the world of grind. Squash Bowels play sick gore/pornogrind with a nice flair. Vocals are gutfuckingly low (and sometimes kind of screamy), and the guitars follow their queue. That isn&#039;t to say that there are no audible riffs, though. I can definitely hear some nice riffs at times. This band sounds like Malignancy, a bit, drum-wise and sometimes vocal-wise. Though Malignancy are more technical, this album reaches its high points with pure grind. Drums are very often blastbeats, and they sound top-notch and don&#039;t really drag down the album like blastbeats sometimes do. Also, a thumbs up on fills. Some slow parts are also inserted, which I found to be rather satisfying, as they show off nice drumming and guitars. The best tracks on the album are "Strong Will," "Life Business," "Handsome Scum," and "The Mass Sickening." Brutal death fanatics and grind fans alike will find something to headbang to in this album, and I guarantee it.
